replies.msg:
REAL SHOULD SIGN NEYMAR'

Brazil legend Ronaldo Nazario has recommended that his old club Real Madrid snap up PSG star Neymar.

Ronaldo, who represented both Barcelona and Madrid during his playing career, believes his compatriot should do the same, although he says he hasn’t heard anything official about the Bernabeu giants’ reported interest in the PSG forward.

"Neymar is a superb player, maybe he will be the best in the world in a few years, and Real Madrid need the best," he is quoted as saying in Marca.

"Well, I didn't plan for anything other than being at Inter for five years, but then there was the possibility and I went because Madrid is a team where everyone wants to play. I haven't heard any official representative of Real Madrid say anything about Neymar.”

replies.msg:
Real Madrid pick Low as Zidane successor

Real Madrid president Florentino Perez has selected Germany boss Joachim Low as the frontrunner to succeed Zinedine Zidane, according to Mundo Deportivo.

Low's "methodology, personality and attitude" has convinced the Blancos chief, who is planning for 2018-19 after a disastrous season at the Santiago Bernabeu.

Massimiliano Allegri, Mauricio Pochettino, Maurizio Sarri and Jurgen Klopp are also on Perez's Real Madrid head coach shortlist.

Man City to move for Isco

Manchester City are showing an increasing interest in unsettled Real Madrid midfielder Isco, reports the Manchester Evening News.

'I COULD PLAY IN PL'

Real Madrid defender Marcelo has admitted he would be interested at trying his hand in the Premier League, although says he would want to retire at the Bernabeu.

Speaking on his YouTube channel, he said: “For me, the best league in the world is the Spanish [league]. The level is very high. A team might be the penultimate one but they will try to play their way out. The goalkeeper does not pump the ball forward but rather they try to play it out from the back.

“I think a league in which I could play would be the Premier League, or maybe I’m too short… I am good here, I stay in La Liga.”

When asked if he imagines retiring at Real Madrid, he replied: “I still haven’t thought about it. I’ve still got five years left on my contract with Madrid. I hope there are more to come. I still haven’t thought about where I want to retire. Madrid have given me everything, it’s my second home and they have given me all the support that I needed. Yes I would like to [retire here], why not?”

PSG-REAL BATTLE FOR COURTOIS

Paris Saint-Germain are battling it out with Real Madrid for the signature of Thibaut Courtois, Le10Sport reports.

quote.msg: Bayern Munich's Poland striker Robert Lewandowski, 29, says rumours of a summer move to Real Madrid "do not interest" him. (Bild - in German)

replies.msg:
'ZIDANE WAS MY IDOL'

Chelsea winger Eden Hazard says Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane was his idol when growing up and while he is flattered by the Frenchman's kind words when speaking about him, insists he is focused on his current club.

"Of course it is. I remember 10 years ago, when he spoke about me for the first time, it was incredible," he said in an interview with Marca.

"You know that he was my idol when I was a boy, I have seen thousands of videos about him and now he is the manager one of the best clubs in the world, so yes, it's a luxury.

"But I don't want to stop, I want to continue working and striving on the pitch and afterwards yes, I love it when people like him speak well of me. In football, you never know. I am happy at Chelsea, and focused to the maximum with them.”

quote.msg:
'ZIDANE WAS MY IDOL'

Chelsea winger Eden Hazard says Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane was his idol when growing up and while he is flattered by the Frenchman's kind words when speaking about him, insists he is focused on his current club.

"Of course it is. I remember 10 years ago, when he spoke about me for the first time, it was incredible," he said in an interview with Marca.

"You know that he was my idol when I was a boy, I have seen thousands of videos about him and now he is the manager one of the best clubs in the world, so yes, it's a luxury.

"But I don't want to stop, I want to continue working and striving on the pitch and afterwards yes, I love it when people like him speak well of me. In football, you never know. I am happy at Chelsea, and focused to the maximum with them.”

replies.msg:
Zidane rubbishes Isco exit rumours amid Chelsea links: I want him here for life!

"I'm glad you've asked me. I was asked before [during the January transfer window] why weren't we going to sign anyone," Zidane told reporters.

"I said I've always believed in my team and I will do until the very end. When I start something I get involved, I believe where I'm going, what I should be doing and I back the people I'm working with.

"Isco's one of them. He a very good footballer. He's proven that in the past and will do that again

"I want Isco [in my team] and I want him to spend his whole life here.
"It's a lie that I want Isco to be sold in the summer. Hopefully we won't hear any more of this."

Nevertheless, Zidane was keen to point out that his backing for Isco did not mean a guaranteed run of starts, given the competition for places in his Madrid squad.

"There's 25 of us. Everyone is important," he said. "I get asked this question by you, by somebody else – why Isco? Why [Marco] Asensio?

"The most important thing for me is the team. Isco won't play every game between now and the end of the season but he's part of the squad.

"I have to pick a team. There are many games.

replies.msg:
'Madrid target Werner not leaving Leipzig

RB Leipzig forward and reported Real Madrid target Timo Werner will 'definitely' stay with the Bundesliga club through next season, sporting director Ralf Rangnick says.

REAL MIDFIELDER WANTED BETIS RETURN

Betis 'keeper Antonio Adan has suggested Madrid midfielder Dani Ceballos wanted to re-join the club last month.

Ceballos joined Real from Betis last summer, but has managed less than 700 minutes of action this season under Zinedine Zidane.

“I spoke with him [Ceballos]. Before and during the process in which he spoke about the possibility of coming here. He wanted to return to Betis. He always said that, if the moment came to possibly leave Real Madrid, it would be to return to Betis, to his home,” he told ABC.

"The manager also had that wish. For paperwork reasons, it couldn't be. Dani has a great affection for the club. The only move that would have made him leave Madrid, where he is growing despite his lack of minutes, would have been to come. He is a different player, one of the good ones, that can be successful at Real Madrid."

Betis 'keeper Antonio Adan has suggested Madrid midfielder Dani Ceballos wanted to re-join the club last month.

“I spoke with him [Ceballos]. Before and during the process in which he spoke about the possibility of coming here. He wanted to return to Betis. He always said that, if the moment came to possibly leave Real Madrid, it would be to return to Betis, to his home,” he told ABC.

"The manager also had that wish. For paperwork reasons, it couldn't be. Dani has a great affection for the club. The only move that would have made him leave Madrid, where he is growing despite his lack of minutes, would have been to come. He is a different player, one of the good ones, that can be successful at Real Madrid."

Guti: I want to see Neymar join Ronaldo at Real Madrid

"Neymar is a different player. He is among the best three in the world. What we like is to see the best in the world," the three-time Champions League winner told Radio Marca.

"If the cost is that Cristiano is not at Real Madrid, you have to think about it.

"But what I want is to see Neymar with Ronaldo in white."

Jose Mourinho's new contract at Manchester United has ended any chance of Cristiano Ronaldo rejoining the Red Devils, according to Le10Sport.

replies.msg:
ZIDANE NOT WORRIED OVER FUTURE

Real Madrid head coach Zinedine Zidane says he is not worried about his future at the club.

The Frenchman is under increasing pressure with Real 17 points behind Barcelona in La Liga, and he is preparing the team for a Champions League last-16 tie against Paris St Germain which could determine whether he stays at the club.

Speaking ahead of Wednesday's first leg in Madrid, he said: "Right now I'm not thinking about my future, I'm only thinking about the game as it's the only thing we can control so we're focusing on preparing for the game and we'll see what happens."

DIAZ: NO MISTAKE FROM REAL

Lyon striker Mariano Diaz says Real Madrid did not make a mistake in letting him leave the Bernabeu last summer.

Mariano has hit the ground running at Lyon, scoring 16 times in his first 31 appearances for the French club, and his performances have contrasted with that of Madrid’s first-choice centre-forward Karim Benzema, who has managed only two league goals this term.

Despite this, the 24-year-old feels Madrid were not wrong to let him join Lyon.

Speaking to El Partidazo on Spanish radio station Cadena COPE, he said: “At Real Madrid they were not wrong to let me go, it was everyone’s decision. It would be a dream to return [there].”
